A4: Racial profiling then grew exponentially and we established a harmful system to police, criminalize, incarcerate or deport non-whites and immigrants. 3/3 #NewWayFoward https://twitter.com/the_ILRC/status/1154081068703608832 …

A4: The laws reinforced anti-black -brown -immigrant stereotypes. Communities were financially disempowered and immigrants were forced into a catch-22 – first requiring them to leave the US to apply for legal status, but in leaving – barring them from returning. 2/3 #NewWayFoward https://twitter.com/the_ILRC/status/1154081068703608832 …

A4: In 1996, black, brown, & immigrant communities were systematically targeted under the guise of welfare & immigration reforms. The laws also expanded which offenses could trigger deportation for an immigrant. This created the massive deportation machine that exists today. 1/3 https://twitter.com/the_ILRC/status/1154081068703608832 …

A2: Non-whites were dehumanized & the idea of good vs bad immigrants was established. Every person deserves safety and dignity, regardless of color, religion, or country of origin, but the 1996 laws sought to undermine the core concept that we are all created equal. 2/2 https://twitter.com/the_ILRC/status/1154077073343799297 …

A2: The most harmful aspect of the 1996 anti-immigration laws was reinforcing false stereotypes that being black, brown, or an immigrant meant you were predisposed to violence, crime, and dependence on government aid.  #NewWayFoward 1/2 https://twitter.com/the_ILRC/status/1154077073343799297 …
